name: Avoid unchecked return code (SY-SUBRC) after opening and reading dataset
description:
This rule searches for all ABAP artifacts that open and read datasets but do not check the value of the return code SY-SUBRC.
The rule takes in account the following cases:
- Use of a temporary variable

OPEN DATASET dsn FOR INPUT IN TEXT MODE ENCODING DEFAULT.

Tmp = SY-SUBRC.

IF Tmp NE 0.
    list of statements
END-IF.

- Use of WRITE statement before return code checking

OPEN DATASET dsn FOR INPUT IN TEXT MODE ENCODING DEFAULT.

WRITE: / Do some testing.

IF SY-SUBRC NE 0.
    list of statements
END-IF.
output:
Associated to each ABAP Artifact with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The number of violation patterns
rationale: Missing return code checks after opening or reading a dataset can result in unpredictable behavior and untraceable execution errors. This is why it is extremely important to report and handle errors as soon as they occur.
remediation: Check the system field SY-SUBRC after file-handling commands.
remediationSample:
DATA:
  dsn(20) TYPE C VALUE '/usr/test.dat',
  rec(80) TYPE C.

OPEN DATASET dsn FOR INPUT IN TEXT MODE ENCODING DEFAULT.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
  EXIT.
ENDIF.

WRITE  / 'Beginning of output'.

READ DATASET dsn INTO rec.
WHILE sy-subrc <> 0.
  WRITE / rec.   
  READ DATASET dsn INTO rec.
ENDWHILE.

WRITE  / 'End of output'.

CLOSE DATASET dsn.
